subject: Subject matter
key_content_summary: Establishes measures for high common level of cybersecurity lays down obligations for Member States and entities

subject: Scope
key_content_summary: Applies to medium-sized+ entities in Annexes I/II excludes national security/defence entities applies to critical entities under CER Directive

subject: Definitions
key_content_summary: Defines 52 terms including network/information system incident cybersecurity essential/important entity

subject: Essential and important entities
key_content_summary: Classifies entities: Annex I=Essential (high criticality) Annex II=Important (other critical sectors)

subject: National cybersecurity strategy
key_content_summary: Member States must adopt strategy with objectives governance risk assessment preparedness measures public awareness

subject: Competent authorities and single points of contact
key_content_summary: Member States designate competent authorities for supervision single point of contact for cross-border cooperation

subject: National cyber crisis management frameworks
key_content_summary: Member States designate cyber crisis management authorities adopt large-scale incident/crisis response plan

subject: Computer security incident response teams (CSIRTs)
key_content_summary: Member States establish/designate CSIRTs with incident handling vulnerability coordination situational awareness tasks

subject: Coordinated vulnerability disclosure
key_content_summary: Member States designate CSIRT as coordinator for vulnerability disclosure ENISA establishes European vulnerability database

subject: Cooperation Group
key_content_summary: Establishes Cooperation Group (Member State representatives) for strategic cooperation information exchange policy guidelines

subject: CSIRTs network
key_content_summary: Establishes CSIRTs network for operational cooperation incident response information sharing at Union level

subject: European Cyber Crisis Liaison Organisation Network (EU-CyCLONe)
key_content_summary: Creates EU-CyCLONe for large-scale cybersecurity incident/crisis coordination links technical and political levels

subject: Corporate responsibility
key_content_summary: Management body approves cybersecurity risk-management measures oversees implementation participates in training

subject: Cybersecurity risk-management measures
key_content_summary: Entities must implement 10 mandatory measures: risk analysis incident handling business continuity supply chain security etc.

subject: Reporting obligations
key_content_summary: Entities report significant incidents in 3 stages: early warning (≤24h) notification (≤72h) final report (≤1 month)

subject: Identification and information to be submitted by entities
key_content_summary: Entities submit name address contact details (email IP ranges telephone) sector/subsector Member States where services provided

subject: Information to be submitted by Member States
key_content_summary: Member States submit to Commission: number of essential/important entities per sector/subsector by 17 April 2025

subject: General aspects concerning supervision and enforcement
key_content_summary: Competent authorities supervise compliance may prioritize based on risk coordinate with CER Directive authorities

subject: Supervisory and enforcement measures for essential entities
key_content_summary: Ex-ante+ex-post regime: on-site inspections security audits binding instructions warnings fines

subject: Supervisory and enforcement measures for important entities
key_content_summary: Ex-post only regime: triggered by evidence of non-compliance targeted audits binding instructions fines

subject: Administrative fines
key_content_summary: Essential: max €10M or 2% global turnover Important: max €7M or 1.4% global turnover for non-compliance with Article 21/23

subject: Transposition
key_content_summary: Member States adopt measures by 17 October 2024 apply from 18 October 2024
